title: "Death of football!" A HEARSE visits the King Power Stadium after Claudio Ranieri's sacking at Leicester City

organizations.name: king power stadium share get liverpool fc

text:
"Death of football!" A HEARSE visits the King Power Stadium after Claudio Ranieri's sacking at Leicester City The funeral procession made the trip before the Foxes' Premier League game against Liverpool Share The Leicester City hearse makes its way past the King Power Stadium Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Leicester City take on Liverpool in a potentially do-or-die game at both ends of the Premier League this evening. 
Ahead of the clash, we dug out our crystal ball to predict the eight things bound to happen during the game. 
But we've got to admit - we didn't see this one happening. 
As fans prepared for their first game without Claudio Ranieri in the dugout - the man who won them the Premier League title last season - a HEARSE paid a visit to the King Power Stadium. 
Yep, that's right. This is what we've come to. 
Displaying a large floral wreath spelling out "RIP FOOTBALL" in the window, the sombre protest was led by a funeral director wearing a half-and-half scarf and drove through the city before arriving at the ground. 
It comes after Ranieri said his "dream died" when he was sacked following their 2-1 defeat to Sevilla in the Champions League last week. 
The stunt was carried out by cheeky bookmakers Paddy Power - who reckon tonight's game "very much feels like a wake" - with some Leicester fans following behind the procession. 
It's certainly one way to make your feelings known. We reckon some of those fans may be rebooking that very hearse for the club should they go down this season... poll loading Does Claudio Ranieri's sacking mark the death of football? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
